title: Rescuers end search for survivors after 14 die in canopy collapse in northern Serbia
content: Serbian rescuers have ceased their search after recovering 14 bodies from a collapsed canopy at Novi Sad railway station, where the tragedy also left three people seriously injured. The government has called for a day of mourning and a thorough investigation, amidst criticism over possible corruption and shoddy renovations. Residents have held a vigil for the victims.
summary: Serbian rescuers have ceased their search after recovering 14 bodies from a collapsed canopy at Novi Sad railway station, where the tragedy also left three people seriously injured. The government has called for a day of mourning and a thorough investigation, amidst criticism over possible corruption and shoddy renovations. Residents have held a vigil for the victims.

title: Battle for the Blue Wall states: Will Trump be able to crack them?
content: As the 2024 U.S. presidential election approaches, Pennsylvania, Michigan, and Wisconsin, known as the 'Blue Wall' states, are key battlegrounds. Both candidates, Vice President Kamala Harris and former President Donald Trump, are focusing heavily on these states. The outcome in these regions could significantly influence the election's result, making them critical to watch.
summary: As the 2024 U.S. presidential election approaches, Pennsylvania, Michigan, and Wisconsin, known as the 'Blue Wall' states, are key battlegrounds. Both candidates, Vice President Kamala Harris and former President Donald Trump, are focusing heavily on these states. The outcome in these regions could significantly influence the election's result, making them critical to watch.

title: Serbia mourns victims after roof collapse kills 14
content: Serbia mourns after a roof collapse at Novi Sad’s main train station killed 14 and left three seriously injured. Authorities have launched an investigation, with Interior Minister Ivica Dacic confirming that 20 people, including ministry and Serbia Railways officials, are being questioned. President Aleksandar Vucic has promised accountability for the tragedy.
summary: Serbia mourns after a roof collapse at Novi Sad’s main train station killed 14 and left three seriously injured. Authorities have launched an investigation, with Interior Minister Ivica Dacic confirming that 20 people, including ministry and Serbia Railways officials, are being questioned. President Aleksandar Vucic has promised accountability for the tragedy.

title: Iran's supreme leader threatens Israel, US with 'crushing response' amid rising regional tensions
content: Iran's Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei has threatened a 'crushing response' against Israel and the United States if attacks on Iran and its allies persist. This statement follows an October 26 attack by Israeli forces on Iranian military bases and a preceding Iranian missile strike in retaliation for Israeli actions against Hezbollah.
summary: Iran's Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei has threatened a 'crushing response' against Israel and the United States if attacks on Iran and its allies persist. This statement follows an October 26 attack by Israeli forces on Iranian military bases and a preceding Iranian missile strike in retaliation for Israeli actions against Hezbollah.

title: 'No male friends, hair and makeup by experts everyday': Dubai influencer reveals millionaire husband's rules
content: Soudi Al Nadak's viral Instagram video showcases the strict lifestyle rules set by her millionaire husband in Dubai, which include coordinating outfits and avoiding work or male friendships. Garnering over 3 million views, the video has received mixed reactions, reflecting admiration for luxury and criticism for personal restrictions.
summary: Soudi Al Nadak's viral Instagram video showcases the strict lifestyle rules set by her millionaire husband in Dubai, which include coordinating outfits and avoiding work or male friendships. Garnering over 3 million views, the video has received mixed reactions, reflecting admiration for luxury and criticism for personal restrictions.

title: Greek police arrest man over Athens apartment blast
content: Greek police have arrested a 31-year-old man linked to a home-made bomb explosion in Athens that killed one and injured another. The explosion, suspected to occur during bomb-making, is associated with anti-establishment guerrilla groups. The suspect denied involvement despite sharing keys to the involved apartment. Recent years have seen a decline in such attacks.
summary: Greek police have arrested a 31-year-old man linked to a home-made bomb explosion in Athens that killed one and injured another. The explosion, suspected to occur during bomb-making, is associated with anti-establishment guerrilla groups. The suspect denied involvement despite sharing keys to the involved apartment. Recent years have seen a decline in such attacks.

title: 'Giving the mic ole Hawk Tuah': Donald Trump's gesture during Wisconsin rally goes viral
content: In the final days before the election, Donald Trump and Kamala Harris held competing rallies in Wisconsin. Trump faced microphone issues leading to a viral moment due to an awkward gesture. Harris’ team posted the clip with a cryptic caption. Despite difficulties, Trump managed to keep the crowd engaged amid the technical problems.
summary: In the final days before the election, Donald Trump and Kamala Harris held competing rallies in Wisconsin. Trump faced microphone issues leading to a viral moment due to an awkward gesture. Harris’ team posted the clip with a cryptic caption. Despite difficulties, Trump managed to keep the crowd engaged amid the technical problems.

title: Social media sensation 'Peanut the Squirrel' euthanized for rabies testing
content: Peanut the Squirrel, a pet of content creator Mark Longo, was euthanized by New York authorities for rabies testing after being seized from his home. Fans initiated a petition and fundraiser to save Peanut, but legal and health guidelines mandated euthanasia. Officials remind the public to contact licensed wildlife rehabilitators for injured or orphaned animals.
summary: Peanut the Squirrel, a pet of content creator Mark Longo, was euthanized by New York authorities for rabies testing after being seized from his home. Fans initiated a petition and fundraiser to save Peanut, but legal and health guidelines mandated euthanasia. Officials remind the public to contact licensed wildlife rehabilitators for injured or orphaned animals.

title: Abortion ban: Pregnant teen in Texas dies after multiple ER visits
content: In Texas, the death of 18-year-old Neveah Crain emphasizes the difficulties created by the state’s abortion ban following the overturning of Roe v. Wade. Despite experiencing severe health crises during her second trimester, Crain received insufficient care due to the restrictive laws. This situation highlights the potential risks faced by pregnant women under such regulations.
summary: In Texas, the death of 18-year-old Neveah Crain emphasizes the difficulties created by the state’s abortion ban following the overturning of Roe v. Wade. Despite experiencing severe health crises during her second trimester, Crain received insufficient care due to the restrictive laws. This situation highlights the potential risks faced by pregnant women under such regulations.

title: 'Who the hell cares?': Donald Trump's remarks on rising sea levels cause stir as he dismisses climate change again
content: Former US President Donald Trump, at a Milwaukee rally, dismissed climate change concerns, calling it overstated and mocking rising sea level fears. Trump emphasized nuclear threats as a greater danger. His stance sharply contrasts with the Biden administration's climate policies aimed at mitigating global warming impacts.
summary: Former US President Donald Trump, at a Milwaukee rally, dismissed climate change concerns, calling it overstated and mocking rising sea level fears. Trump emphasized nuclear threats as a greater danger. His stance sharply contrasts with the Biden administration's climate policies aimed at mitigating global warming impacts.

title: From 'dipsh*t' to 'that gay guy': Tim Walz's remarks on Elon Musk spark backlash
content: At a Detroit rally, vice presidential candidate Tim Walz referred to Elon Musk as "that gay guy," sparking a mix of laughter and criticism online. This followed Walz's previous comments mocking Musk's alignment with Trump. The Harris-Walz campaign has not responded to the controversy as it unfolds just days before the US elections.
summary: At a Detroit rally, vice presidential candidate Tim Walz referred to Elon Musk as "that gay guy," sparking a mix of laughter and criticism online. This followed Walz's previous comments mocking Musk's alignment with Trump. The Harris-Walz campaign has not responded to the controversy as it unfolds just days before the US elections.

title: US deploys more ballistic missile defences in Middle East to protect Israel
content: The United States has enhanced its military presence in the Middle East by deploying additional ballistic missile defence destroyers, fighter squadrons, tanker aircraft, and B-52 bombers. This move aims to protect US interests, defend Israel, and promote de-escalation through diplomacy. The US warned Iran against targeting American personnel.
summary: The United States has enhanced its military presence in the Middle East by deploying additional ballistic missile defence destroyers, fighter squadrons, tanker aircraft, and B-52 bombers. This move aims to protect US interests, defend Israel, and promote de-escalation through diplomacy. The US warned Iran against targeting American personnel.

title: 'Faith bird that feels light when dawn is still dark': US secretary of state Antony Blinken quotes Rabindranath Tagore at Diwali celebrations
content: US secretary of state Antony Blinken highlighted Rabindranath Tagore's words at the state department’s Diwali reception. President Biden and vice president Harris participated, recognizing Diwali's significance. Biden hosted a record Diwali event at the White House, inviting around 600 Indian-Americans.
summary: US secretary of state Antony Blinken highlighted Rabindranath Tagore's words at the state department’s Diwali reception. President Biden and vice president Harris participated, recognizing Diwali's significance. Biden hosted a record Diwali event at the White House, inviting around 600 Indian-Americans.

title: Fake video depicting voter fraud in Georgia part of Russian misinformation campaign: US
content: US intelligence officials reveal a fabricated video by Russian operatives claiming voter fraud in Georgia, cautioning continued foreign election interference. The FBI and other agencies proactively address disinformation, identifying this as part of Russia's effort to undermine election trust and divide Americans.
summary: US intelligence officials reveal a fabricated video by Russian operatives claiming voter fraud in Georgia, cautioning continued foreign election interference. The FBI and other agencies proactively address disinformation, identifying this as part of Russia's effort to undermine election trust and divide Americans.

title: Gay Trump supporter explains why Trump has 'normal gays'
content: Ohio Senator JD Vance, on Joe Rogan's podcast, discussed LGBTQ+ rights, focusing on medical interventions for gender transitions. Vance and Rogan questioned the support for early gender transition policies. Trump’s record on LGBTQ+ issues was highlighted, including the appointment of the first openly gay cabinet member and efforts to end HIV/AIDS transmission.
summary: Ohio Senator JD Vance, on Joe Rogan's podcast, discussed LGBTQ+ rights, focusing on medical interventions for gender transitions. Vance and Rogan questioned the support for early gender transition policies. Trump’s record on LGBTQ+ issues was highlighted, including the appointment of the first openly gay cabinet member and efforts to end HIV/AIDS transmission.

title: Kamala Harris vows to end 'unnecessary' degree requirements for federal jobs on day one
content: Kamala Harris pledged to eliminate unnecessary degree requirements for federal jobs via executive order on her first day as president. Addressing a crowd in Janesville, she emphasized this move's potential to broaden access to federal employment and challenged the private sector to follow suit. Harris’s proposal builds on the Biden administration’s push for skills-based hiring.
summary: Kamala Harris pledged to eliminate unnecessary degree requirements for federal jobs via executive order on her first day as president. Addressing a crowd in Janesville, she emphasized this move's potential to broaden access to federal employment and challenged the private sector to follow suit. Harris’s proposal builds on the Biden administration’s push for skills-based hiring.

title: Elon Musk reacts to reports that he could be deported for immigration violation
content: Elon Musk is from South Africa and he dismissed allegations that he violated US immigration law. Even President Joe Biden spoke about the issue as he said, "That wealthiest man in the world turned out to be an illegal worker here when he was here." “He was supposed to be in school when he came on a student visa. He wasn’t in school. He was violating the law. He’s talking about all these ‘illegals’ coming our way,” Biden said.
summary: Elon Musk is from South Africa and he dismissed allegations that he violated US immigration law. Even President Joe Biden spoke about the issue as he said, "That wealthiest man in the world turned out to be an illegal worker here when he was here." “He was supposed to be in school when he came on a student visa. He wasn’t in school. He was violating the law. He’s talking about all these ‘illegals’ coming our way,” Biden said.

title: Watch: Hugh Hewitt storms out of Washington Post live saying 'I'm done', resigns
content: ​When Hewitt's turn came to speak he said the news needed to be reported. “Bucks County was reversed by the court and instructed to open up extra days because they violated the law and told people to go home,” he said. ​​Capehart told Hewitt, “I don’t appreciate being lectured about reporting when, Hugh, many times you come here saying lots of things that aren’t based in fact.” “I won’t come back, Jonathan, I’m done,” he said. “You guys are working, that’s fine, I’m done.”
summary: ​When Hewitt's turn came to speak he said the news needed to be reported. “Bucks County was reversed by the court and instructed to open up extra days because they violated the law and told people to go home,” he said. ​​Capehart told Hewitt, “I don’t appreciate being lectured about reporting when, Hugh, many times you come here saying lots of things that aren’t based in fact.” “I won’t come back, Jonathan, I’m done,” he said. “You guys are working, that’s fine, I’m done.”

title: 'Lying Liz'? Did Donald Trump call for Liz Cheney's execution? Here's the truth
content: "This is how dictators destroy free nations. They threaten those who speak against them with death. We cannot entrust our country and our freedom to a petty, vindictive, cruel, unstable man who wants to be a tyrant," Liz Cheney said. The Republicans condemned the use of "death" in her reaction and claimed Trump never wished for Liz Cheney's death -- what Trump meant is 'war hawk' Liz Cheney should be sent to war, otherwise the warmonger Democrats will keep on sending troops sitting in Washington.
summary: "This is how dictators destroy free nations. They threaten those who speak against them with death. We cannot entrust our country and our freedom to a petty, vindictive, cruel, unstable man who wants to be a tyrant," Liz Cheney said. The Republicans condemned the use of "death" in her reaction and claimed Trump never wished for Liz Cheney's death -- what Trump meant is 'war hawk' Liz Cheney should be sent to war, otherwise the warmonger Democrats will keep on sending troops sitting in Washington.

title: Three dead, three injured in Halloween house party shooting in Colorado
content: A tragic Halloween house party in Northglenn, Denver, ended in gunfire, killing three and injuring three others just past midnight. Police found one deceased victim at the scene, while two more died after being hospitalized. No suspects have been apprehended, though officials state there are no public threats at this time.
summary: A tragic Halloween house party in Northglenn, Denver, ended in gunfire, killing three and injuring three others just past midnight. Police found one deceased victim at the scene, while two more died after being hospitalized. No suspects have been apprehended, though officials state there are no public threats at this time.
